channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: George Conway, a Trump Foe, Changes Home and Party to Run for Congress
item.description: The former conservative has moved from the Washington suburbs to Manhattan and will run for an open House seat in a heavily Democratic district.

item.title: President Trump stands ready to send U.S. Big Oil into Venezuela en masse, but the messy reality of rebuilding a ruined industry takes many years
item.description: Doubling Venezuela's weakened oil flows could cost $110 billion and take until 2030.

item.title: Trump’s strike on Venezuela gives the U.S. 30% of the world’s oil reserves on paper and a $100 billion rebuilding job in reality
item.description: “I don't think any large U.S. major company is going to want to invest without a series of guarantees,” one historian of Venezuela said.

item.title: Facing Challenge From Lander, Dan Goldman Prepares to Defend His Seat
item.description: Mr. Goldman, a Democrat from New York City, faces a stiff primary battle that could turn on Gaza and how to fight President Trump.

item.title: Peace Is Unraveling
item.description: As states disregard limits on the lawful use of force, this may be just the beginning of a slide into frequent war.

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Five Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Tim Walz’s 17 Months in Politics Before Ending His Re-election Bid
item.description: Mr. Walz drew national notice when Kamala Harris chose him as her running mate. A fraud scandal derailed his bid for re-election as Minnesota’s govern...

item.title: Optimism About Nuclear Energy Is Rising Again. Will It Last?
item.description: Companies like Kairos Energy are building new types of reactors with the encouragement of the Trump administration, but their success is far from assu...

item.title: Live Updates: Venezuela Isn’t Ready for Elections, Trump Says
item.description: President Trump told NBC News that the United States must first “nurse the country back to health,” and named a group of U.S. officials to oversee the...

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for Five Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Map: 5.7-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Japan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Energy stocks rip as JP Morgan estimates the U.S. could hold 30% of all the world’s oil
item.description: U.S. control of the Venezuelan energy industry could “reshape the balance of power in international energy markets,” analysts with JP Morgan wrote Mon...

item.title: Trump tells NBC U.S. may reimburse firms for Venezuela oil efforts
item.description: Energy experts say reviving Venezuela’s oil industry could be a decade-long process, and could cost upwards of $100 billion.

item.title: Under Biden, America got 150 countries to agree a 15% global corporate tax. Under Trump, America gets an exemption
item.description: Scott Bessent called it “a historic victory in preserving U.S. sovereignty and protecting American workers and businesses from extraterritorial overre...
